c74object.name: ibuffer~
c74object.digest: Load an audio file into memory in the same sample format as on disk
c74object.description: ibuffer~ is an audio file buffer that loads audio files in their stored integer format (or float format if relevant). This object is designed primarily for applications with large memory requirements where loading in 16 bit or 24 bit formats saves vital space in memory. It supports 16, 24 and 32 integer formats, as well as 32 bit float and can load either all channels or specified channels (up to 4 in either case). There are a corresponding set of playback and other objects that will also function with standard MSP buffers. Sound file loading is done using libsndfile by Erik de Castro Lopo (http://www.mega-nerd.com/libsndfile/).

objarg.name: name
objarg.description: The first argument is a name used by other objects to refer to the ibuffer~ to access its contents.

objarg.name: filename
objarg.digest: Set the audio file to be loaded
objarg.description: After the ibuffer~ object's name, can type in the name of an audio file to load upon opening the patch.

method.name: name
method.digest: Set the name of the ibuffer
method.description:
Set the name used by other objects to refer to the ibuffer~ to access its contents. The message should be formatted as:
name / buffer name

method.name: open
method.digest: Replace the contents of the ibuffer
method.description:
Replace the contents of the ibuffer and resize it.
The message should be formatted as:
replace / audio file
Adding an int at the end of the message specifies the channel of the audio file to be loaded.
